column1: The latest on Operation Warp Speed and other items in today's COVID-19 update: https://t.co/otrpnml5Ji

Joined @realDonaldTrump this afternoon for a visit to Fujifilm Diosynth in Morrisville which is manufacturing a COVID-19 vaccine candidate as part of the Trump Administration’s Operation Warp Speed. https://t.co/WmdHuYHIDF

“For most persons with COVID-19 illness isolation and precautions can generally be discontinued 10 days after symptom onset1 and resolution of fever for at least 24 hours without the use of fever-reducing medications and with improvement of other symptoms.”
“Available data indicate that persons with mild to moderate COVID-19 remain infectious no longer than 10 days after symptom onset” the CDC says and can therefore end quarantine.

Very encouraging news from #OperationWarpSpeed which announced a partnership with Pfizer for large-scale production & delivery of a COVID-19 vaccine should it receive FDA approval.   MORE: https://t.co/fhk34ufWWO  Means 100 million+ doses as fast as possible if FDA approves.
Negotiations are underway on the next round of COVID-19 relief legislation -- that and other items in today's update:  https://t.co/MT4cTxlDyK
North Carolina hits 100000 confirmed COVID-19 cases -- that and other items in today's update: https://t.co/Hnjog4s7XV
More testing for nursing homes hospitalizations remain high in NC Bladen County Schools releases its school reopening plan & more in today's COVID-19 update:   https://t.co/WbVyKQl2wR

The @DeptVetAffairs is offering debt relief through the end of the year for veterans impacted by COVID-19.   This relief will help our veterans focus on protecting themselves and their loved ones from COVID-19 and give them more flexibility during the pandemic.

Don’t miss this op-ed by former FDA Commissioner Scott Gottlieb on how schools can be safely reopened this fall.  Kids are far less likely to contract the virus than adults.  In the U.S. kids are 22% of the population but just 1.7% of COVID-19 cases.   https://t.co/k3YXIVebX8

NC COVID-19 Update:  On Saturday North Carolina reported the state’s highest one-day total of new confirmed COVID-19 cases with 2462. 1040 individuals are hospitalized statewide.  North Carolina has completed more than 1.22 million tests and so far has recorded 87528 cases.
North Carolina today for the first time reported more than 1000 individuals hospitalized due to COVID-19 -- that and other items in today's update:  https://t.co/3dtgTj63TZ

Here's a snapshot of the COVID-19 outbreak in the counties that make up the 7th District:  (1/2) Bladen County: 406 cases 4 deaths  Brunswick County: 677 cases 7 deaths  Columbus County: 570 cases 39 deaths  Duplin County: 1595 cases 28 deaths

The @waynecountygov will offer free COVID-19 testing in Goldsboro 9am-12pm on Tuesday & Thursday at the GWTA Transit Center 103 N. Carolina St.    Testing is open to everyone but preregistration is recommended.   Call 919-731-1000 from 8am-5pm today or Monday to preregister.
